etymology.description: 非(非) (fēi, "not; wrong") + 常(常) (cháng, "ordinary; usual") = beyond the ordinary
etymology.interpretation: The word 非常(非常) (fēicháng, "very; extremely") combines 非(非) (fēi, "not; wrong") and 常(常) (cháng, "ordinary; usual") to express the idea of something that goes beyond the ordinary or usual, hence being very or extremely in nature.

examples.chinese: 我今天非常高兴(我今天非常高興)。
这本书非常有趣(這本書非常有趣)。
他们非常努力(他們非常努力)，终于成功了(終於成功了)。
examples.english: They worked very hard, and finally succeeded.
